query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Benigna volontade in che si liqua 2 sempre l’amor che drittamente spira, 3 come cupidità fa ne la iniqua,
query.error: **English:** 1 Gentle goodwill in which is dissolved 2 always the love that rightly inspires, 3 as lust does in the wicked,
query.result: 1 Volontez benyn yn aga lyw 2 an garow sywpre yn spira yn onest, 3 dell yw’th lust yn an dus,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 silenzio puose a quella dolce lira, 5 e fece quïetar le sante corde 6 che la destra del cielo allenta e tira.
query.error: **English:** 4 imposed silence on that sweet lyre, 5 and made those holy strings be still 6 that the right hand of heaven loosens and tightens.
query.result: 4 a ros sens dhe’n lyra dowr, 5 ha’gas quïet an kordennow sans, 6 aga lyw dhe dhew dhe’n nef a dhrehev ha tyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Come saranno a’ giusti preghi sorde 8 quelle sustanze che, per darmi voglia 9 ch’io le pregassi, a tacer fur concorde?
query.error: **English:** 7 How will those substances be deaf to just prayers, 8 which, to give me the desire 9 to pray to them, were in agreement to be silent?
query.result: 7 Dell yw’th justya gwedhyow a vydh sord, 8 an substansow hyn, rag dhom rey voglia 9 rag y’m pregassi, dhe tasser o synsys?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Bene è che sanza termine si doglia 11 chi, per amor di cosa che non duri 12 etternalmente, quello amor si spoglia.
query.error: **English:** 10 It is right that he should grieve without end 11 who, for love of something that does not last 12 eternally, strips himself of that love.
query.result: 10 Da yw dell yw heb termen dhe golli, 11 neb, rag karow a dra na vydh par, 12 an garow hyn a spolia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Quale per li seren tranquilli e puri 14 discorre ad ora ad or sùbito foco, 15 movendo li occhi che stavan sicuri,
query.error: **English:** 13 Like a sudden fire that darts from time to time 14 across the tranquil and clear heavens, 15 moving the eyes that were fixed,
query.result: 13 Dell yw rag an sterennow trank ha pur 14 a discurra a-ura dhe a-ura foco subit, 15 movyans an golgow hwra o synsys,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 e pare stella che tramuti loco, 17 se non che da la parte ond’ e’ s’accende 18 nulla sen perde, ed esso dura poco:
query.error: **English:** 16 and seems like a star that changes place, 17 except that from the part where it kindles 18 nothing is lost, and it lasts a short time:
query.result: 16 ha’gas parra steren aga treylya le, 17 mes na dhyworth an rann owna’th en acend, 18 nawn a gollir, ha’gas a wra par.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 tale dal corno che ’n destro si stende 20 a piè di quella croce corse un astro 21 de la costellazion che lì resplende;
query.error: **English:** 19 such a star ran from the horn that extends to the right 20 at the foot of that cross, 21 from the constellation that shines there;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 né si partì la gemma dal suo nastro, 23 ma per la lista radïal trascorse, 24 che parve foco dietro ad alabastro.
query.error: **English:** 22 nor did the jewel depart from its ribbon, 23 but ran along the radial line, 24 which seemed like fire behind alabaster.
query.result: 22 na’gas a bartya an gemma dhyworth y’n nastro, 23 mes rag an lista radial a dremennas, 24 aga parra foco dhrehev dhe alabastro.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 Sì pïa l’ombra d’Anchise si porse, 26 se fede merta nostra maggior musa, 27 quando in Eliso del figlio s’accorse.
query.error: **English:** 25 So did the shade of Anchises show itself, 26 if our greatest muse deserves faith, 27 when in Elysium he noticed his son.
query.result: 25 Dell yw pïa an scouth a’n Anchise a ros, 26 mar feyth a wra dhe’n musa moyha, 27 pan yn Eliso a welas y’n flogh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 «O sanguis meus, o superinfusa 29 gratïa Deï, sicut tibi cui 30 bis unquam celi ianüa reclusa?».
query.error: **English:** 28 “O my blood, O grace of God 29 poured down upon you, so that to you 30 the gate of heaven was twice opened?”.
query.result: 28 “O’m gwaskva, o gras De dhyswla, 29 dell yw dhe’th, dhe neb erbyn 30 dhe dhiskler an iana dhe’n nef?”.
31 Dell yw an golon hyn: dhyworth aga y’m attessy dhe, 32 wosa a drehevas va’m fac dhe’n va’m donna, 33 ha’gas ha hyn a’m stupifyas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 ché dentro a li occhi suoi ardeva un riso 35 tal, ch’io pensai co’ miei toccar lo fondo 36 de la mia gloria e del mio paradiso.
query.error: **English:** 34 for within her eyes a smile was burning 35 such that I thought to touch the depth with mine 36 of my glory and of my paradise.
query.result: 34 Rag y’n golgow hyn a wra arda ris, 35 dell yw y’m cresas gans va’m dhe tocca an downder 36 a’m gloria ha’m paradys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Indi, a udire e a veder giocondo, 38 giunse lo spirto al suo principio cose, 39 ch’io non lo ’ntesi, sì parlò profondo;
query.error: **English:** 37 Then, joyful to hear and to see, 38 the spirit reached the beginning of his words, 39 which I did not understand, he spoke so profoundly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 40 nor did he hide himself from me by choice, 41 but by necessity, because his concept 42 surpassed the understanding of mortals.
query.result: 40 Na rag y’n eleccion a wra cusys dhe dhym, 41 mes rag necessitas, rag y’n concepcion 42 a wra surpass an syn a’n mortal.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 solvuto hai, figlio, dentro a questo lume 53 in ch’io ti parlo, mercè di colei 54 ch’a l’alto volo ti vestì le piume.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.result: 58 Ha rag aga y’m ha ha rag aga y’m par 59 moyha joyus dhe’th, ty na wra govyn dhym, 60 dell yw neb aral yn an turba joyus hyn.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 «O fronda mia in che io compiacemmi 89 pur aspettando, io fui la tua radice»: 90 cotal principio, rispondendo, femmi.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 Fiorenza dentro da la cerchia antica, 98 ond’ ella toglie ancora e terza e nona, 99 si stava in pace, sobria e pudica.

query.result: 97 Florença a-ves dhe’n kethvos koth, 98 a-dhyworth aga hi a wra gavos byth an tres ha’n naw, 99 oen a wra yn peth, sobras ha pudyk.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Non avea catenella, non corona, 101 non gonne contigiate, non cintura 102 che fosse a veder più che la persona.
query.error: **English:** 100 She had no golden chain, no crown, 101 no gowns with long trains, no belt 102 that was more to be seen than the person.
query.result: 100 Nyns oen kedhen, nyns oen kurun, 101 nyns oen gonow gans hir lostow, nyns oen gwregys 102 a vydh dhe weles moy ages an person.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Non faceva, nascendo, ancor paura 104 la figlia al padre, che ’l tempo e la dote 105 non fuggien quinci e quindi la misura.
query.error: **English:** 103 At birth, the daughter did not yet cause fear 104 to her father, for time and dowry 105 did not flee the measure here and there.
query.result: 103 Nyns oen gwul, genys, owna an tas 104 dhe’n tas, rag an amser ha’n dos 105 nyns oen fugi a-dhyworth henna ha thonna an mesur.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 106 He did not have a family home there; 107 Sardanapalus had not yet arrived there 108 to show what can be done in a bedroom.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Non era vinto ancora Montemalo 110 dal vostro Uccellatoio, che, com’ è vinto 111 nel montar sù, così sarà nel calo.
query.error: **English:** 109 Montemalo was not yet surpassed 110 by your Uccellatoio, which, just as it is surpassed 111 in the ascent, so it will be in the descent.
query.result: 109 Nyns esa gwrys Mons Malo 110 gans dha Uccellatoio, hag avel ytho 111 yn kodha dhegor, hemma yn kodha dhegor yn kodhes.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Bellincion Berti vid’ io andar cinto 113 di cuoio e d’osso, e venir da lo specchio 114 la donna sua sanza ’l viso dipinto;

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 e vidi quel d’i Nerli e quel del Vecchio 116 esser contenti a la pelle scoperta, 117 e le sue donne al fuso e al pennecchio.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 Oh fortunate! ciascuna era certa 119 de la sua sepultura, e ancor nulla 120 era per Francia nel letto diserta.

query.result: 118 Oh gwragedh forth! pub onen o ev sur 119 a'y beuri, ha namoyth neb 120 yn Pow Frynk o ev tremensys yn y gwely.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 Maria mi diè, chiamata in alte grida; 134 e ne l’antico vostro Batisteo 135 insieme fui cristiano e Cacciaguida.
query.error: **English:** 133 Mary gave birth to me, called out in loud cries; 134 and in your ancient Baptistery 135 I was made a Christian and Cacciaguida at the same time.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

query.error: **English:** 136 Moronto and Eliseo were my brothers; 137 my wife came to me from the valley of the Po, 138 and that is where your surname originated.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Poi seguitai lo ’mperador Currado; 140 ed el mi cinse de la sua milizia, 141 tanto per bene ovrar li venni in grado.
query.error: **English:** 139 Then I followed the Emperor Conrad; 140 and he invested me with his knighthood, 141 so much did I please him with my good deeds.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Dietro li andai incontro a la nequizia 143 di quella legge il cui popolo usurpa, 144 per colpa d’i pastor, vostra giustizia.
query.error: **English:** 142 I followed him against the wickedness 143 of that law whose people, through the fault 144 of their shepherds, usurp your rightful authority.
query.result: 142 Wosa henna yth fylghyn yn erbynn an drygweth 143 a'n les na, an pobel a wra 144 owth omsettya, dre vras an bescob, dha jystyns.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.

148 e venni dal martiro a questa pace».
